description: XyWrite was a word processor available for MS-DOS and early versions of Microsoft Windows in the 1980s and 90s. Because XyWrite contained many powerful (but tough-to-learn) editing features and commands, it was popular in newspaper editorial offices, where it was used to write and edit articles for publication.
The Windows version of XyWrite saved documents as XYW files. Other versions of XyWrite saved documents in other formats, including .XY , .XYP , and .XY3 .
